required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Obesity Effect on Stroke and Cardiovascular Events
clinical_study.official_title: OBESITY ASSOCIATION WITH RECURRENT STROKE AND CARDIOVASCULAR EVENTS

brief_summary.textblock: The relation between obesity and stroke recurrence is still under debate. In this study it has been sought whether baseline obesity is associated with recurrent stroke and major cardiovascular events in a long-time period.

detailed_description.textblock: Five-years follow-up data of Ege Stroke Registry for stroke recurrence and cardiovascular events regarding to obesity were analyzed. Data include age, gender, stroke severity, neuroimaging studies, cardiovascular risk factors. Within the inclusion period, all of the included patients were followed until censoring (10th of December 2011) or readmission because of recurrent stroke, cardiovascular event or death, whichever came first. The Kaplan-Meier method was used for survival analysis. Cox proportional hazard model was applied to identify predictors of recurrent vascular events.

arm_group.description: Obesity in those with BMI â‰¥30 kg/m2
Normal weight was considered in the patients with BMI <30 kg/m2

intervention.description: Body mass index (BMI (kg/m2) was calculated from measurements of weight to the nearest kg and height

study_pop.textblock: All stroke patients enrolled in the prospective cohort registry in Egeanregion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All consecutive stroke patients.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incomplete baseline information, other factors making them unsuitable for follow-up,undetermined stroke, subarachnoid hemorrhage.

patient_data.ipd_description: If the publisher will accept to share IPD, we can give permission to share IPD.
